Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can draw a plant that has plenty of water, showing it looking healthy and growing well with details like green leaves and an upright stem.
The student can draw a plant without water, depicting it as wilted or not growing well, possibly with drooping leaves and a bent stem.
The student can illustrate the concept that plants need water to live and grow by comparing a healthy plant with a wilted plant in their drawing, showing clear differences between the two.
CANNOT: The student may sometimes miss details like showing roots or might not fully capture the process of a plant wilting (student focuses primarily on the visible parts of the plant).
The student might inconsistently label parts of the plant or might leave out labels entirely in some parts of their drawing (student assumes the drawing is self-explanatory).
